study.title: High prevalence of methicillin resistant staphylococci strains isolated from surgical site infections in Kinshasa

design.inclusion_criteria_text: Hospitalized surgical patients with purulent lesions of infected sites in two major hospitals of Kinshasa.

country_specific_sites: Provincial General Reference Hospital of Kinshasa (HGPRK)

eligibility.population: Hospitalized surgical patients with purulent lesions of infected sites

populations.description: All hospitalized surgical patients with purulent lesions of infected sites in two major hospitals of Kinshasa

provenance.text_snippet: from purulent lesions of infected sites of 130 hospitalized surgical patients

definitions.resistance_definition_text: Evaluation of the results was done according to the criteria of Clinical Laboratory Standards Institute (CLSI) [10]. Test for methicillin resistance was performed with diffusion method using oxacillin (1 µg) on Mueller Hinton agar with 4 % NaCl.

lab_methods.specimen_collection_method: Wound swab collected using sterile cotton swabs in Stuart transport media after aseptic cleaning with normal saline and sterile gauzes.
lab_methods.culture_method: Inoculation into mannitol-salt agar, incubation at 37°C for 24 hours.
lab_methods.QC_measures: S. aureus ATCC 25923 and Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 12228 were used for quality control.
lab_methods.organism_identification_method: Gram staining, catalase reaction, latex agglutination test (Pastorex Staph-Plus), DNase test.

amr_proportions.mdr_definition_text: Multidrug resistance was observed in MRSA and MR-CNS strains.
amr_proportions.mrsa_detection_method: disk diffusion using oxacillin (1 µg) on Mueller Hinton agar with 4% NaCl

amr_proportions.mrsa_detection_method: disk diffusion using oxacillin (1 µg) on Mueller Hinton agar with 4% NaCl

risk_factors_effects.exposure: high pressure use of broad spectrum antibiotics or long hospital stay
risk_factors_effects.notes: Attributed as possible drivers of high MRSA and MR-CNS prevalence in discussion.

provenance.text_snippet: can be attributed to the high pressure use of broad spectrum antibiotics or to the long stay hospital

interventions.description: Recommendation for national antibiotic surveillance policy due to high prevalence of multidrug resistant MRSA and MR-CNS.

provenance.text_snippet: This study suggests that antibiotic surveillance policy should become national priority as MRSA and MR-CNS were found to be multidrug resistant.

policy_capacity.status_text: Lack of antibiotic surveillance policies in DRC noted.

provenance.text_snippet: remains unknown due to lack of antibiotic surveillance policies

codes.summary: High prevalence of MRSA (63.5%) and MR-CNS (60%) among staphylococcal isolates from SSIs in Kinshasa.

evidence_quotes.quote: Out of 74 S. aureus and 15 CNS isolated, 47 (63.5%) and 9 (60%) were identified as MRSA and MR-CNS respectively.

codes.location_context: Kinshasa, DRC, Provincial General Reference Hospital and Clinic of University of Kinshasa

provenance.text_snippet: Out of 74 S. aureus and 15 CNS isolated, 47 (63.5%) and 9 (60%) were identified as MRSA and MR-CNS respectively.

codes.summary: High MRSA and MR-CNS prevalence may be attributed to broad spectrum antibiotic use and long hospital stays.

evidence_quotes.quote: The highest MRSA and MR-CNS prevalence observed in our study can be attributed to the high pressure use of broad spectrum antibiotics or to the long stay hospital.

provenance.text_snippet: can be attributed to the high pressure use of broad spectrum antibiotics or to the long stay hospital

codes.summary: Standard microbiological methods and CLSI disk diffusion were used for identification and susceptibility testing.

evidence_quotes.quote: S. aureus and CNS strains were identified by standard microbiological methods and latex agglutination test (Pastorex Staph-Plus). The antibiotic susceptibility of all staphylococcal strains was carried out using disk-diffusion method.

provenance.text_snippet: standard microbiological methods and latex agglutination test (Pastorex Staph-Plus). The antibiotic susceptibility of all staphylococcal strains was carried out using disk-diffusion method.

codes.summary: Antibiotic surveillance policy is lacking in DRC and recommended as a national priority.

evidence_quotes.quote: MRSA and MR-CNS from SSIs to antibiotics remains unknown due to lack of antibiotic surveillance policies.

provenance.text_snippet: remains unknown due to lack of antibiotic surveillance policies
